roleplay.list.header: ğŸ“œ RP commands for this chat:
documentation.sections.overview.title: â„¹ï¸ Main commands
/menu â€” leave the current menu and return to the main view.
documentation.sections.filters.title: ğŸš¦ Filters
documentation.sections.filters.content.0: /filteradd â€” add a new rule (reply to a message).
documentation.sections.filters.content.4: /filterclear â€” remove all filters in the chat.
documentation.sections.filters.content.5: /filterlistall â€” browse filters saved across chats (admin only).
documentation.sections.filters.content.6: Use {randomUser}, {randomMention} or {randomRpUser} in templates to mention a random member.
documentation.sections.filters.content.7: Tags {argument} and {argumentNoQuestion} insert text after the trigger (with or without question marks).
documentation.sections.roleplay.title: ğŸ² Roleplay
documentation.sections.settings.title: âš™ï¸ Settings
/language â€” choose the bot language for this chat.
documentation.sections.autodelete.title: â™»ï¸ Auto-delete
documentation.sections.autodelete.conten: /autodelete /command â€” add a command to auto-delete.
/nodelete /command â€” exclude a command from auto-delete.
documentation.sections.moderation.title: ğŸ›¡ Moderation module
documentation.sections.moderation.conten: /kick â€” kick a user without a ban.
/modlevel â€” assign moderation levels (0 = members, 5 = chat creator; levels control all moderation actions).
/restrict â€” list members with a specific moderation level (add mention=off to hide profile links).
/restrictcommand â€” limit a command to a specific moderator level.
/award â€” give a user a custom award.
/delreward â€” remove a previously issued award.
/mods â€” show every moderator grouped by level (add mention=off to hide profile links).
